meanings.sent1: After the rain, the dry soil will resorb the water.
meanings.sent2: The sponge can resorb the spilled milk.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty plant seemed eager to resorb the droplets of rain.
meanings.sent4: The desert sand seemed to resorb the footprints left by the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The paper towel quickly resorbed the spilled juice.

meanings.definition: To take back into the body by resorption
meanings.sent1: The body will resorb the nutrients from the food we eat.
meanings.sent2: The intestines can resorb water to prevent dehydration.
meanings.sent3: The cells in our body work hard to resorb the essential minerals.
meanings.sent4: The skin can resorb some medications applied topically.
meanings.sent5: The bones can resorb calcium to maintain strength.

meanings.sent1: As the tooth loosens, it will resorb into the gum.
meanings.sent2: During healing, the body will resorb the excess tissue.
meanings.sent3: The old bone will resorb to make way for new growth.
meanings.sent4: The damaged tissue will resorb as part of the natural healing process.
meanings.sent5: The body will resorb the temporary fillers over time.
